snippet: Kate Kelly and John P. Dehlin were notified this week by the church that their activism on ordaining women and admitting openly gay members could lead to their expulsion.
abstract: Kate Kelly and John P Dehlin, prominent Mormons who have pushed church to ordain women and to accept openly gay members, face excommunication for apostasy; move is first time since 1993 that the church has moved so forcefully to quash critical voices, and comes during period in which it has worked to project an image of greater diversity and openness.
lead_paragraph: Kate Kelly and John P. Dehlin were notified this week by the church that their activism on ordaining women and admitting openly gay members could lead to their expulsion.

headline.main: Two Activists in Mormon Church Threatened With Excommunication
headline.print_headline: 2 Threatened With Removal by Mormons Over Campaign

keywords.value: Mormons (Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints)
keywords.name: subject
